returnValue.description: Returns 1 if Info is equal to the leading characters of Information and 0 otherwise.

variables.variableDescription: The complete string to see if Info is an abbreviation of.
The string to see if it is an abbreviation of Information.

returnValue.description: As with ABBREV(Information,Info). A Null string will always match if length is 0.

variables.variableDescription: The complete string to see if Info is an abbreviation of.
The string to see if it is an abbreviation of Information.
The minimum length that Info must be.

returnValue.description: The absolute value of Number. This has no sign and is formatted according to the current NUMERIC settings.

variables.variableDescription: The number to get the absolute value of.

returnValue.description: The name of the environment to which commands are currently being submitted. See the ADDRESS instruction for more information.
The number of arguments passed into the program or internal routine.

examples: ARG() == 0 /* with no arguments passed I.E. (Call Function)      */
ARG() == 3 /* with 3 arguments passed  I.E. (Call Function 1,,2) */

returnValue.description: The String value of the Argument N (starting from 1). This returns the Null String if the argument does not exist or if it is greater than the number of arguments passed to the program or internal routine. See ARG(). See also PARSE ARG.

variables.variableDescription: The argument index to retrieve (starting from 1).

returnValue.description: Depending on Option tests whether the argument N exists or was omitted.

variables.variableDescription: The argument index to retrieve (starting from 1).
The value 'E' to test if the argument exists or 'O' to test if the argument was omitted.

returnValue.description: Returns the String passed into the function unmodified.

variables.variableDescription: The String to return from the function.

returnValue.description: Returns the String that is a result of binary ANDing String1 and String2 together. The AND starts at the far left and continues until the shorter of the two strings is exausted. The length of the returned string is that of the longest passed in String.

variables.variableDescription: The String to AND with String2.
The String to AND with String1.

returnValue.description: Returns the String that is a result of binary ANDing String1 and String2 together with PAD applied to the shorter string until it equals the length of the longer String. The AND starts at the far left and continues until the shorter of the two strings is exausted. The length of the returned string is that of the longest passed in String.

variables.variableDescription: The String to AND with String2.
The String to AND with String1.
The Padding to be aplied to the shorter string before the AND is perfromed.

returnValue.description: Returns the String passed into the function unmodified.

variables.variableDescription: The String to return from the function.

returnValue.description: Returns the String that is a result of binary ORing String1 and String2 together. The OR starts at the far left and continues until the shorter of the two strings is exausted. The length of the returned string is that of the longest passed in String.

variables.variableDescription: The String to OR with String2.
The String to OR with String1.

returnValue.description: Returns the String that is a result of binary ORing String1 and String2 together with PAD applied to the shorter string until it equals the length of the longer String. The OR starts at the far left and continues until the shorter of the two strings is exausted. The length of the returned string is that of the longest passed in String.

variables.variableDescription: The String to OR with String2.
The String to OR with String1.
The Padding to be applied to the shorter string before the OR is perfromed.

returnValue.description: Returns the String passed into the function unmodified.

variables.variableDescription: The String to return from the function.

returnValue.description: Returns the String that is a result of binary XORing String1 and String2 together. The XOR starts at the far left and continues until the shorter of the two strings is exausted. The length of the returned string is that of the longest passed in String.

variables.variableDescription: The String to XOR with String2.
The String to XOR with String1.

returnValue.description: Returns the String that is a result of binary XORing String1 and String2 together with PAD applied to the shorter string until it equals the length of the longer String. The XOR starts at the far left and continues until the shorter of the two strings is exausted. The length of the returned string is that of the longest passed in String.

variables.variableDescription: The String to XOR with String2.
The String to XOR with String1.
The Padding to be aplied to the shorter string before the XOR is perfromed.

returnValue.description: The hexadecimal value that the passed in binary String represents.

variables.variableDescription: A String representation of a binary value (only ones and zeros and spaces).

returnValue.description: A Centered String in the spcified Length amount of space. Padded equally on both sides with spaces. If Length is less than the length of String then String is truncated from both sides to the length Length. Additionally, if an odd number of characters are truncated or added, the Right hand end loses or gains one more character than the left hand end. May also be specified as CENTRE.

variables.variableDescription: The String to center in Length.
The Length to center String into.

returnValue.description: A Centered String in the spcified Length amount of space. Padded equally on both sides with Pad. If Length is less than the length of String then String is truncated from both sides to the length Length. Additionally, if an odd number of characters are truncated or added, the Right hand end loses or gains one more character than the left hand end. May also be specified as CENTRE.

variables.variableDescription: The String to center in Length.
The Length to center String into.
The Pad character to add around String.

returnValue.description: A Centered String in the spcified Length amount of space. Padded equally on both sides with spaces. If Length is less than the length of String then String is truncated from both sides to the length Length. Additionally, if an odd number of characters are truncated or added, the Right hand end loses or gains one more character than the left hand end. May also be specified as CENTER.

variables.variableDescription: The String to center in Length.
The Length to center String into.

returnValue.description: A Centered String in the spcified Length amount of space. Padded equally on both sides with Pad. If Length is less than the length of String then String is truncated from both sides to the length Length. Additionally, if an odd number of characters are truncated or added, the Right hand end loses or gains one more character than the left hand end. May also be specified as CENTER.

variables.variableDescription: The String to center in Length.
The Length to center String into.
The Pad character to add around String.

returnValue.description: The Character Position in which String1 and String2 differ (0 meaning that they are the same String). If one string is shorter than the other then it is padded with a spaces until their lengths are equal.

variables.variableDescription: The string to compare to String2.
The string to compare to String1.

returnValue.description: The Character Position in which String1 and String2 differ (0 meaning that they are the same String). If one string is shorter than the other then it is padded with the Pad char until their lengths are equal.

variables.variableDescription: The string to compare to String2.
The string to compare to String1.
The Pad Char to add the shorter string until it matches the other strings length.

returnValue.description: The name of the trapped condition.
The information associated with the current trapped condition. Condition name, Description, Instruction, or State.

variables.variableDescription:
C-Condition name. Returns the name of the current trapped condition.
D-Description. Returns any descriptive string associated with the current trapped condition.
I-Instruction. returns the keyword for the instruction executed when the current condition was trapped.
S-State. Returns the state of the current trapped condition.

returnValue.description: N directly concatenated copies of String.

variables.variableDescription: The String to produce multiple copies of.
The number of copies of String to produce, must be positive or 0.

returnValue.description: The decimal value of the binary representation (encoding) of string. If the result cannot be expressed as a whole number, an error results - that is, the result must not have more digits than the current setting of NUMERIC DIGITS.

variables.variableDescription: The String to be converted. This may be the null strig, in which case '0' is returned. This is assumed to be an unsigned value.

returnValue.description: The decimal value of the binary representation (encoding) of string. If the result cannot be expressed as a whole number, an error results - that is, the result must not have more digits than the current setting of NUMERIC DIGITS.

variables.variableDescription: The String to be converted. This may be the null strig, in which case '0' is returned. This is assumed to be an signed value of length N.

The number of characters (starting from the right and moving left) in which to consider the conversion of String. if N is longer than the length of String Then '00'x is prepended to the string before conversion.

returnValue.description: The hexedecimal representation (unpacked value) of a character String. All values A-F will be upper case and contain no blanks.

variables.variableDescription: The string to be unpacked. This may be of any length, and if it is the null string then a null string is returned.

returnValue.description: The value 'NUM' or 'CHAR' depending on whether the String can be added to '0' without error.

variables.variableDescription: The String to test the Datatype of.

returnValue.description: Whether or not String is of the type Type. If String is null and Type is not 'x' then 0 (False) is returned.

variables.variableDescription: The String to test the Datatype of.

A - (Alphanumeric) Returns 1 if String only contains characters from the ranges 'a-z', 'A-Z', and '0-9'.
B - (Binary) Returns 1 if String only contains the characters '0' and/or '1'.
L - (lower case) Returns 1 if String only contains characters from the range 'a-z'.
M - (Mixed Case) Returns 1 if String only contains characters from the ranges 'a-z' and 'A-Z'.
N - (Number) Returns 1 if DATATYPE(String) would return 'NUM'.
S - (Symbol) Returns 1 if String only contains characters that are valid in REXX symbols. Note that lower case alphabetics are permitted.
U - (UPPER CASE) Returns 1 if String only contains characters from the range 'A-Z'.
W - (Whole Number) Returns 1 if String is a REXX whole number under the current setting of NUMERIC DIGITS.
X - (heXadecimal) Returns 1 if String only contains characters from the ranges 'a-f', 'A-F', '0-9', and blank (so long as blanks only appear between pairs of hexadecimal characters, as usual.) Also returns 2 if String is a null string, which is a valid hexadecimal string.

returnValue.description: The current date in the format 'dd Mmm yyyy.
The current date in a certain format.

variables.variableDescription:
B - (Base) returns the number of complete days (not including the current day) since and incliuding th base date: 1 Jan 0001.
D - (Days) Returns the number of days, including the current day, so far in this year in the format 'ddd' (no leading zeros or blanks)
E - (European) returns the date in the format 'dd/mm/yy'
M - (Month) Returns the full English name of the current month, in mixed case.
N - (Normal) explicitly returns the date in default format.
O - (Ordered) Returns the date in the format 'yy/mm/dd' (suitible for sorting, etc.)
S - (Standard) Returns the date in the format 'yyyymmdd' (suitible for sorting, etc.) Note that this is one of the three forms recommended for ISO/R 2014-1971 (E).
W - (Weekday) Returns the English name for the day of the week, in mixed case.

returnValue.description: Converts the Date in InputDate formatted in the type of Option 2 to the type of Option 1. Default for Option if unspecified is 'N'.

variables.variableDescription:
B - (Base) returns the number of complete days (not including the current day) since and incliuding th base date: 1 Jan 0001.
D - (Days) Returns the number of days, including the current day, so far in this year in the format 'ddd' (no leading zeros or blanks)
E - (European) returns the date in the format 'dd/mm/yy'
M - (Month) Returns the full English name of the current month, in mixed case.
N - (Normal) explicitly returns the date in default format.
O - (Ordered) Returns the date in the format 'yy/mm/dd' (suitible for sorting, etc.)
S - (Standard) Returns the date in the format 'yyyymmdd' (suitible for sorting, etc.) Note that this is one of the three forms recommended for ISO/R 2014-1971 (E).
W - (Weekday) Returns the English name for the day of the week, in mixed case.
The date to convert from.

returnValue.description: The String returned after deleting all characters from String starting at the nth character. if n is greater than the length of String then the string is returned unchanged.

variables.variableDescription: The String to be deleted from.
The character to start deleting from.

returnValue.description: The String returned after deleting all characters from String starting at the nth character for length length . if n is greater than the length of String then the string is returned unchanged. Additionally, length must be non negative.

variables.variableDescription: The String to be deleted from.
The character to start deleting from.
The length to delete from the String, starting from <span> n <span>.

returnValue.description: The String returned after deleting all words from String starting at the nth word. if n is greater than the number of words in String then the string is returned unchanged.

variables.variableDescription: The String to be deleted from.
The word to start deleting from.

returnValue.description: The String returned after deleting all words from String starting at the nth word for length amount of words. if n is greater than the number of words in String then the string is returned unchanged. Additionally, length must be non negative.

variables.variableDescription: The String to be deleted from.
The word to start deleting from.
The number of words to delete from the String, starting from <span> n <span>.

returnValue.description: The current setting of NUMERIC DIGITS. See the NUMERIC instruction for more information.
A Character String of length as needed. WholeNumber must be a non-negative number or an error will result. The result is returned is such that there are no leading '00'x characters.

variables.variableDescription: The Whole Number to Convert to the character representation of.

returnValue.description: A Character String of length N . The result is returned to the length specified by N and is sign extended or truncated if necessary.

variables.variableDescription: The Whole Number to Convert to the character representation of.
The Final Length of the return string.

returnValue.description: A Hexadecimal String of length as needed as a hexidecimal representation of the decimal number. WholeNumber must be a non-negative number or an error will result. The result is returned contains 0-9, A-F, and no spaces.

variables.variableDescription: The Whole Number to Convert to the hexidecimal representation of.

additionalInfo: Convert Number to a Hexidecimal String.

returnValue.description: A Hexidecimal String of length N . The result is returned to the length specified by N and is sign extended or truncated if necessary.

variables.variableDescription: The Whole Number to Convert to the hexidecimal representation of.
The Final Length of the return string.

additionalInfo: Convert Number to a Hexidecimal String.

returnValue.description: The REXX error message associated with the Error Number N.

variables.variableDescription: The Error Number. Must be between 0 and 99. if not defined then the null String is returned.

returnValue.description: The current setting of NUMERIC FORM.

Returns the position of one string, Needle, in another, Haystack. (See also the LASTPOS function.) If the string Needle is not found, or is the nulll string, 0 is returned. By Default the search starts at the first character of haystack (this is, start has the value of 1). This may be overridden by specifying start (which must be positive), the point at which to start the search. See POS(Needle,Haystack,Start) for more information.

variables.variableDescription: The string to search for.
The string to search through.

returnValue.description: As with POS(Needle,Haystack) this overload searches through Haystack for Needle starting at the specified Start Position. Start must be positive.

variables.variableDescription: The string to search for.
The string to search through.
The string to search through.
